pageContext.desc: Legal and financial documents of an 18th-century Connecticut businessman and Continental Army purchasing agent.

pages.transcription:
Mr. Chauncey Whittelsey
Bout of Compt. Sage
1776
Aug. 6
11 Axes ... @ 6/6 ... British pound sign 3 ?
Recd the contents of the above in full
Ebenr Sage

Middletown 24th May 1777
Mr Chansaw Whillesey Sr.
Their is a present? Call for Two thousand h.superscript ts of Cheese, which Please to procure with Out Delay, for the Use of the Armey, am Sr Your Humble Servant. Elijjah Hubbard Comesary.

The Shirts I sent you before were 14s each
I now send you 5 Do. at 14s 6 for Shirt 3.12.6
4 Do. at 16s for Shirt .. 3.4.0
1 Do. at 14s ------- 14

                           _______
                           7.10.6

Sir I find it difficult to procure Shirts at the price you allowed me, common chuke is 6s per yd. you must raise your omen or I can procure none ingrocess are bussy in purchasing Butter and Cheese, and in fact every article, if I can serve you in procuring any thing you want I shall be glad to do it, you will inform me what to do by the Bearer I am Sir your humble Servt. Olivr Stanley
Wallingford 28th July 1777
To Mr. Chauncey Whittelsey
P.S. People have wovs but little of their Chuk Cloth as yet

To all people to whom these presents shall come Greeting
Know yea that I Robert Shelley of Guilford in the county of Newhaven for avalable sum paid to my Brother Ebeneser Shelly & for the consideration of forty shillings money to me in hand paid by Seth J Wetmore - Esqr of Middleton - in Hartford County do give grant bargain & sell Remise and forever quit claim to him the said Seth Wetmore his hiers and assigns for ever all the Rights Tytle Share & Interest I have in any Land, in the Township of Middleton & Chatham in the county of Hartford for that I am one of the children and hiers of Mary Shelly and by purchase of my Brother Samuell Shelly now deceased.
To have and to hold to him the said Seth Wetmore his hiers and assign forever in witness whereof I have let my hand & seal this 7th Day of May 1773 -.
Robert Shelley
Signed Sealed & Delivered
In Presence
Joseph Clark
Hannah Clark
Middletown May 7th 1773 then Personally appeared Mr. Robert Shelley. Signed & Sealer of the foregoing Instrument and Acknowledged the same to be his price Act and Deed. Before me -
Jabez Hamilin Just: Pace:
March 25th. 1779.   Recorded in
Middletown Records Libr 22.
Folio 340. Sent Boz:Fisk Regm -

Seth Wetmore Esqr
Deed from
Robert Shelley
March 25 1779
Recorded

200,000 Dollars                             July 3 - 1779
Sir,
pay to his Excellency Jonathan Trumbull Esquire Governor of the State of Connecticut On his Order the sum of two hundred thousand Dollars for the purpose of supplying clothing for their Quota of Troops in the Continental Line - to be paid out of Monies in your Hands collected for the Use of the United States - And for which two hundred thousand Dollars the said State is to be accountable.
I am, 
Sir, 
your very hble Servant
John Jay - President

Order
T M N Haven
Dated July 22 1779
£1800:0:0
C
Recd 23 July 1779 of Treasurer Lawrence
Six thousand dollars
Roger Sherman

Norwich Aug 14th 1779
Dear Sir
I herewith send you by Cap Leffingwill two Thread & 1 Bag of Clothing from the Towns of Preston & Groton their Bills of the Cost & are Incld -- they are packd as follows Vin
162 shirts abbrev for pairs w No1
81 Frocks abbrev for pairs w No1
162 abbrev for pairs overhalls abbrev for pairs w No1
36 abbrev for pairs stockings abbrev for pairs w No1
36 abbrev for pairs shoes in abbrev for included w No2
45 abbrev for pairs ac Bag w No3
from the Town of Groton and Bill dated the 5th     Jul £3251:4:     £3101:1:0
128 shirts ----------------------------------------

92 abbrev for pairs overhalls----------  abbrev for included w No2

from the Town of Preston and Bill dated the 4th of Jul    £1872:7:9      £177:11:9
2 #ds & one bag for Sam ------------------ 6
Carting to Landins & Storage ------------
I should have sent some of the Norwich clothing but thought it more prudent to send part by another conveyance which will be in a few days
am ? your most Hble Servant
Aw Huntington
Chauncy Whittelsey Esqr

Chauncy Whittelsey Esqr

Recd Middletown Aug 24th 1779 of Chauncey Whittelsey Purchg Clothier one order on Pay Table in favour of Capn Jonas Prentice Comtee of Cloathing for Town of New Haven for Seven Hundred Ninety. four Pounds four Shillings and five Pence it being ballance due for Cloathing this day delivered.  Peter Johnson
£794:4:5    Pd

Recd from Comtee of Cloathing for Town of New Haven
Aug 24th 1779
£794.4.5
C

Norwich Aug 31st 1779
Dear Sir
I have shipped by Capt Smith Two Thread and one twine? of cloathing from the Town of Norwich as per  memorandum at foot -- the Committee had not all the Cloathing Ready therefore could not give a Bill of the cost. Expect to have the Remainder to send Next week by Capt Ingraham when I shall have their Bill of the whole -- Conclude the Cloathing shipped by Capt Caren & Leffingwell is to hand with this may arrive same - am in haste DTis your humble servant Aw Huntington
Mom -2 Gt & 1 Tierw Cloathing from the town of Norwich Vis

Sept. 24th 1779
C.

Norwich Sept. 28 1779
Dear Sir 

  I unclear your favour by unclearwith the Cash & orders

I am very sorry there was not more money as I am afraid I shall be Disappointed in getting the money in season of the Constable? as the Rates are not Due & so many unclear Pressing? for payments - unclear I have ventur'd to engage 3 unclear Beaver Hats at 40 
4 unclear unclear unclear at 18
unclear 1000 unclear at 84/-
I have promised to pay for the whole unclear the first of Nov - though they want all to finish by that time, unclear unclear not set themselves low - these Hats will almost take up the Cash & the Orders - if you would wish to have any more Hats of any Kind then supply me with the money to Pay for them as soon as they are finished - I think I can engage them if I can hear from you soon - am Dr Sir your Most Humble Servant? 
A Huntington 
PS I should take it a great favour if you could send me on or Two Barrels of flour for my own use - if to be had for {{unclear]] 20 pounds Hundred - I Believe there is some of our vessels up the River

Andrew
Nuntingtonbiq
Sept. 28th 1779
L.
